page.title: 13NEWT FOUND IN NEW ROMNEY
page.content: ON 25TH APRIL 1985 TIM STRETTON IAIN SHORT PAUL KNIGHT AND RICHARD MORRIS WENT TO MR.WADDELL'S POND IN COCKREED LANE TO CATCH NEWTS.THEY CAUGHT A SMOOTH NEWT IN A NET AND THEN CAUGHT AN EXTRA LARGE FEMALE GREAT CRESTED NEWT.AT FIRST THEY THOUGHT IT WAS A LIZARD AND THAT IT WOULD BITE THEM PAUL PICKED IT UP . IF THEY PUT IT IN A COFFEE JAR LONGWAYS IT WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO SWIM ABOUT. IT WAS SLIMEY AND BLACK WITH A ROUGH SKIN.ITS BREAST WAS BRIGHT ORANGE WITH BLACK SPOTS.IT COULD MOVE QUITE FAST AND HAD BUMPS ON ITS BACK.IT WAS WARM TO THE HAND. IT HAD A BIG MOUTH AND ORANGE TOE NAILS.THE FIELD CENTRE AT CANTERBURY IDENTIFIED IT.WE PUT IT BACK INTO THE POND AS SHE MIGHT MATE.
